1151.content:
To be perfectly honest with yourself, you were surprised you had survived as many years as you had. You were a Vulpix in a world where anything can take you down at any time. Sure, you could breathe fire, but you were never good at it. You never got a chance to hone that natural skill because you, of all things, hated the concept of hurting other people; be it plants, animals, humans, or other Pokemon.

Vulpix are generally an effeminate species, and surprisingly, that carried onto you, a male. One might mistake you for a female easily, leastwise until you tell them. Some might call you frail, weak, or cowardly, others might call you smart, handsome, or dutiful. You were a very, very shy individual, and always avoided social contact, which left you with few friends to help you out later in life, though that's not to say you had none.

While you did lack in the bravery and fighting departments, you were pretty good-looking for a male Vulpix, though not in a rugged way; more in a youthful, smooth way. You'd missed out on plenty of chances with other Vulpix when you were younger, ones that were totally into you, but you didn't mind. Heck, you were still confronted by some every now and then, but since you don't live in as high a population as you used to, it didn't happen as often.

And though not many would think you good at very much, you were surprisingly duty-minded when it came to getting a job done. Obviously there were certain things you simply could not do in regards to your moral code of conduct or personal preference, such as hunting or night watching, but you were really good at things like grooming, sorting, finding, decorating, and diplomacy with other neighboring Pokemon.

To accompany your overall non-masculine stature, your voice was also pretty light for a male. That never was really a bad thing though, as it was not only cute, but smooth. That combination made it almost melodious to listeners as long as you were calm, which was pretty interesting. To top it all off, you were affixed with a sort of inferiority complex, and paranoia that made you more wary than anybody you'd met.

Overall, it was unusual for a Pokemon as passive as you to have survived up to the late teenage years. But you did, and that was something you were grateful for. You HAD had your fair share of run-ins with trouble, though, like the one time you barely managed to sweet-talk your way out of getting eaten whole by a Lapras near the beach, or the time you actually were forced to get raped by a Dragonite in exchange for not getting eaten by it after accidentally stumbling upon its cave home, because it thought you were a female; you still shudder every time you think about it. You never told anybody about it, not even your closest friend, a male Pikachu.

Today, you decided to take a pleasant walk through the forest. This was where all the accordingly peaceful Pokemon lived (well, most of them were peaceful anyway), such as other Vulpix, Pikachu, little Nidoran and Sandshrew. Suddenly, though, you hear a twig snap; your head immediately swivels in that direction, and you preemptively well up with fear.

You wait for the worst, your worry getting the better of you. Your muscles and legs tense and are ready to flee at a moment's notice, but are shaking with a terribly-concealed fear. If whatever was nearby was hostile, you probably would stumble and fall.

Fortunately, it isn't hostile! The yellow figure steps from beneath the shade, revealing himself to be your best pal, Pryce. He was a pikachu, another species that neighbored your forest home.

"Hey, Kyrie!" he calls out to you. His expression is a wide grin at first, but quickly switches to that of confusion upon seeing how scared you look. You loosen up and let out a sigh upon realizing who it is. You return an exasperated greeting.

"Were you really scared? You have to chill out, Kyrie; you're gonna have a heart attack one day." You nod, regaining full composure.

"Sorry...yeah." You look down, then back up into his eyes. He was your best friend for a reason; he was tough and knew how to defend not only himself, but you as well. The both of you had grown up in a mostly peaceful area with little to no conflict whatsoever, but he was a pugilist and you were a pacifist; it felt only right for him to help you out when you needed it.

"No apologies necessary. Look, I just came by to tell you something: there's apparently a huge cave near the far edge of the forest! We gotta check it out, don't you think?" The very mention of the forest's edge makes you cringe.

"What? Um, are you sure? E-everyone says it's dangerous just to go past the lake. Who knows what will find us?" Your voice begins to grow a little louder with anxiousness, but Pryce disregards your anticipation with a wave of his hand.

"The better question is: who knows what we will find? There's bound to be some cool stuff there. And besides, if bad turns to worse, you have me!" He punctuated the last with a purposefully cheesy wink and a laugh. You sighed, knowing there was no getting through to him once he had an idea. You didn't want to use a negative word as stubborn...more like 'determined', or 'single-minded'.

"I...I don't think we should, Pryce; but alright. We'll check it out, but can we please be careful?" You practically pleaded with that last sentence, causing your pal to laugh a little at how seemingly pathetic you sounded.

"Of course! Thanks for going through with it, buddy," he said knowingly.



The sect of the forest you two adventure through is quite dark. The trees are much larger and the leaves much thicker than the ones that dot your home, blotting out all but the thinnest rays of sunlight. Your head snaps back at every noise you hear, but Pryce marches on proudly just a few steps ahead of you.

It was when you were swimming when your life changed dramatically.

The last thing you remember back then was the rippling of the water, and then a strange, smooth feeling that seemed to suddenly Wrap around you, and you found yourself caught up in the coils of a huge serpent Pokemon called Dragonair. It seemed that it wanted you for lunch. However, it must have had feelings because when you began crying for your parents, it hesitated.

Then suddenly, another huge serpent Pokemon appeared, but this time it was a Milotic. She seemed to like you, and you could tell by the way she licked you softly.

But when the Dragonair suddenly scooped you in its mouth, you thought you were done for. But for some reason, its tongue kept you from slipping down its throat. What was it doing? You didn't know, but you held little hope that you would ever see your family again.

After about 20 minutes of lying in the Dragonair's mouth, you suddenly saw its mouth open, and its tongue gently lifted you out. You found yourself in a nice, warm cave. Looking behind you, the huge pool of water near where you have come out from the Dragonair seems to be the only way out, but dangerous, since the water goes so deep before the cave wall actually terminates, allowing creatures like Milotic and Dragonair to easily slide through and enter the free world outside.

Looking around, you notice the ground seems to mostly consider of rock-pools and stalagmites, lined up in the formation of a maze. Surprisingly, you find yourself smiling. You like this. A place like this might actually be fun. You remember how you always used to chase your daddy's tail in a game of tag back home. You could practice your dodging actions here; it might even help you to avoid predators in the future.

You turn to see the Dragonair slide out of the water towards you, followed by the Milotic. The Milotic loops gently around you, as if compressing you to a soft degree of comfortableness. You actually find yourself feeling grateful. The Dragonair looks down at you in a curious way. Perhaps he has never been around children before? Maybe not.

"You little darling," the Milotic coos. She looks up at the Dragonair. "Honey, why don't you find something for it to eat? It will be night soon, and I'm certain this little sweetie will be hungry."

"Okay, honey," the Dragonair says. "I'll be back soon." He slowly slips back into the water and vanishes out of sight.

As you watch him go, you suddenly feel very tired. You rest your head against the Milotic's coils, and your eyes close. You then hear a soft chuckle, and you feel a soft, warm tongue brushing over your cheek.

But as you nod off, one final thought enters your mind...

Will I ever see my mommy and daddy again?

12211221222.content:
It has now been a few years since you were found by your adoptive parents.

And over the years, you've actually found it to be quite liveable. Their cave was like a second home to you. The Dragonair often played the game tag with you, especially when he learned you love that game so much. You often liked to dodge around all the obstacles inside the cave (and even hide behind some of them) until you were caught, and then chase him back around obstacles, watching him slide between them and even over them. It was great fun.

Basically, the Dragonair has become like a father to you. The same can be said for the Milotic, whom you look up to as a mother. They've taught you some wonderful talents; talents that your kind doesn't often learn.

The only thing strange thing about life here is the food. Although the food they bring you to eat mostly consists of berries, you've noticed that your "parents" have also brought back other types of Pokemon as well. You couldn't help but notice. Some of them barely moved, some of them put up quite a struggle, but they all ended up the same way: sliding down their gullets. At first, you felt horrible at the sight of your "parents" swallowing their prey down, but eventually, you grew accustomed to it.

Then one day, it happened. Your "parents" came home with food as usual. This time they had brought back a family of Raticate. Upon noticing one of its baby Rattatas falling free of the bundle, you pounced forward from a hiding place, and seized it. You grabbed its tail in your mouth and held it up, hanging loosely. With the Dragonair and Milotic watching you, you took hold of the Rattata, took in a deep breath, and then put it in your mouth. Surprisingly, it actually tasted quite nice. You could feel it struggling in your mouth, but you had a secure grip on it. After a moment, you finally managed to swallow it down.

When you were done, you looked up at your "parents", who were beaming like the sun. This seemed to confirm something; you weren't a child anymore. You were older now, and capable of becoming a predator just like anything else.

So from that day on your "parents" brought you fresh Pokemon for you to vore down. You loved it, especially the Ice-types; they were amazingly chilly, but sweet.

Then one day...

You were holding on to your Dragonair father's head-wings, going for a ride through the beautiful world of water. You had grown accustomed to keeping your breath under water, and this was a secret talent that your "parents" had known even before you arrived. It was most useful for when you wanted to go swimming.

Suddenly, there was a swoop through the water, and you felt a rush right behind you. The action was so sudden that you slipped off and drifted into the water. You heard your "father" gasp in surprise, but suddenly, like lightning, the surprise attacker shot by again. It would have had you there, had you not been able to dodge (or roll) through the water (another talent you learned).

Then you see what it is: it's a Sharpedo, a cruel, cunning adversary. What it's doing here in your "parents" territory you're not sure, but it looks like its intentions are on you.

Another near miss, and you find yourself sinking down to the bottom. You hit the soft floor, and then, when it seems you're at your mercy, you notice something glinting beside you. Unless your eyes deceive you, it looks like a scale.

A Milotic scale.

You carefully pick it up. Did your "mother" leave it here? You don't have time to think about it, however, because suddenly...

The scale suddenly starts to glow brightly in your paws, and before you know it, you notice a bright light radiating off your body. You can feel the evolution making you feel stronger.

Suddenly, the scale disappears in your hands as you start to feel different. You feel something slowly creeping its way through your paws, and your body begins to stretch...making you feel longer. Then you feel your breath go as something in your throat disengages, and you panic for a moment, until you realize that your breathing in the water is not affecting you anymore. You then feel something covering over your body, like a veil, and your tail lengthens in size. Finally, you feel something spreading out from your backside, stretching out wide.

Finally, the light dissipates and the evolution is complete. But you don't have time to rejoice, as suddenly, you notice the Sharpedo is still coming straight at you. You attempt to dodge again, and find yourself suddenly performing a Dragon Dance. You don't recall learning this talent from your "parents"; surprisingly, you learned it yourself! The dance causes you to dodge away with even more ease than you had before.

The Sharpedo seems confused, but swoops at you again. This time you begin to spin in the water, performing a Twister move. This talent you did learn from your parents, but it seems so much easier now with your new form. The water whips around you as you perform the Twister, and the Sharpedo actually loses control and collides straight with a nearby rock.

You then whip out your lengthened tail, and attack the Sharpedo hard with an Aqua Tail move. You give it a few good whacks before finally, the Dragonair rushes onto the scene and bites the Sharpedo hard on its waist, marking its death.

You feel your ears tingle as you sense something else coming, and you see the Milotic appear. "Darling, what happened?" she asks her husband. Then she sees you, and gasps. "Oh my...what happened?"

Looking down upon yourself, you notice your body has been covered in hard, purplish-colored scales. Your tail has been stretched out to twice the size it was before, with a star-shaped fin on the end. Your claws have also changed; they're not the standard Eevee claws you remembered having. They've become more sharply-rounded. And on your back, you can see a small pair of red wings on your back; in a way, they seem to be accustomed for swimming - and flying.

"Our child's all grown up now," the Dragonair spoke at last, before finally mouthing the Sharpedo's limp form and turning in the direction of the cave. The Milotic just smiles at him. You excitedly begin to swim around in the water, using your newly-found wings for propelling yourself forward. Your Milotic mother watches you with pride as you experiment with your new body. Then you aim up for the surface of the ocean, and kicking yourself upwards you launch out of the water and flip over a 360' before landing back in the water. You swim up again, and this time as you rise up out of the water, you call out your new name...

"SCALEON!!!"

Some time later...

You are celebrating with your "parents" over your new evolution. Now that you've officially evolved into a whole new form probably never seen before, you're now actually quite able to take care of yourself.

Then you feel your stomach growling, and you realize that you're hungry. From the way your "parents" smile at you, they know what you're about to do.

So...it's time to hunt!!!
